intro: Parietaria floridana, commonly known as Florida wallrocket, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in wetlands, ditches, and along roadsides. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellowish-green and arranged in clusters. Parietaria floridana is often considered a weed but has ecological value in supporting insect life.
